subject: 2 requests re: mascot splash template
description:
(Danny, please note an additional request for info, any thoughts on item 1?)

Hi all. Just spoke to Danny about this on the phone, info on first possible date you could do this would be much appreciated. If there's any room to do it on Monday then the news will be particularly welcomed.


1)      We're going to use the 'Mascot splash' template in the london2012.com CMS to aggregate content related to the London 2012 mascots' song that's on sale. Currently the template is hard-coded to pull in the main scrolling banner images from the same place no matter how many times you replicate it on the site. Those images are http://www.london2012.com/images/mascots/mascot1.jpg and http://www.london2012.com/images/mascots/mascot2.jpg .



For the version of the template that currently sits at http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/index.php we'd like this to remain the same. However, for the new version of the template that I've created at http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/index.php but haven't published yet, we'd like to pull in two different images instead (eg. .../mascot3.jpg and .../mascot4.jpg ?). Can this be altered in the code fairly easily?




2)      We would like the Facebook and Twitter social buttons in the breadcrumb on the new page at http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/index.php to act as shares rather than subscriptions. This would mean:


-          changing the Twitter 'follow' button to a 'tweet' button (which pre-populates a tweet linking back to the page). The current link to @London2012 that sits next to the 'follow' button could be replaced by a counter reflecting how many times the new 'tweet' button has been used.



-          Changing the function of the 'Like' button to 'share' of the link on the user's Facebook wall. The counter for this button will need to be reset to reflect the number of times the page has been shared



-          The +1 button can stay the same as it already serves the purpose we want.





Finn Concannon
New Media Producer
LOCOG New Media
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 918

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001
www.london2012.com

Update:

Images of the correct proportions are now placed here: http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/mascotsong1.gif and here http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/mascotsong2.gif. They'll need to link respectively to http://l2012.cm/nmG1pU and http://mascot-games.london2012.com/#/games please.

It's just struck my that I can't check these look ok on the page until you make the changes to http://www.london2012.com/games/mascots/mascot-song/index.php so that it pulls in the images above instead of the ones it currently pulls in. Will give you a shout first thing Monday

The carousel images are now editable on the mascots splash template.

Changing the twitter and facebook links is much harder as these are generic components used by all pages. It would require significant re-working the mascots splash template or of the component.

K, thanks Danny, will check ASAP this afternoon

Ta also for info re: social links. Have to check but think I know the answer, do you think there’s any room for the social button changes to be implemented before the end of tomorrow?

Finn, could you double-check with Tom re: the social links? There may be a wider issue here if there are likely to be several instances of different social links on different parts of the site. Instead of hacking up something as a one-off it might be worth looking at ways we could make it easy to change these links on different pages in future (although I haven't really thought seriously about how yet!).

Will do, I think it’s ok for now though Dan. Definitely worth me giving it some consideration if we get other one off campaigns where we’d like to consider applying those changes, but it’s understandable we won’t be able to sort it in time for this one.

Ta for the timeliness with all the other stuff here, appreciate it.

subject: Translated news story - title length
description:
Hi,

We're trying to change the title on a French-language news story on the London 2012 website but are being prevented from doing so by an apparent character limit.

The story in question is here https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/pages/edit/fr/news/2011/09/les-chefs-de-mission-se-rendent-a-londres-pour-assister-a-une-reunion-d-info.php

The current title is  Les Chefs de mission se rendent à Londres pour assister à une réunion d'information sur les Jeux Paralympiques

We want to change it to  Les chefs de mission se rendent à Londres pour assister à une réunion d'information sur les Jeux Paralympiques
However, when we attempted to do so the following message appeared...

Value too large for column "KADMIN"."ITEM$"."DISPLAY_NAME" (actual: 83, maximum: 80) at "KADMIN.K$ITEM", line 1156 at line 1

Presumably this message pops up anytime you exceed the character limit, which seems straightforward. However, I'm a bit confused here as I'm not actually looking to change the character limit, so wonder how we were able to save it with 83 characters in the first place if there is an 80 character limit.

Does this character limit apply only to manual titles we create? i.e. as this is a returned translation, does it somehow bypass the standard character limit rules?

Thanks

Michael Thorne
Content Coordinator
Editorial Services department
Direct line:  +44 (0)20 3 2012 046

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games Ltd
One Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London E14 5LN

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0)20 7719 1308
london2012.com<http://www.london2012.com/>

subject: Kitsite Review of proposed Apache configuration from BT
description:
We have sent Kitsite a proposed Apache configuration from BT that will be needed to be actioned to allow BT to manage the apache configuration on the Webservers.

We would like Kitsite to review the proposed configuration items and comment on any issues that they may have with implementing the recommended configuration.

The next strps from this will be to install the agreed apache configuration onto the staging servers stage03 and stage04 and performing regression testing.

The next strps from this will be to install the agreed apache configuration onto the staging servers stage03 and stage04 and performing regression testing.

Russ, it's going to take a fair amount of time to go through the items on this spreadsheet and give a proper response to each of the items marked "Application Developers to confirm any negative impact of making this standard config". With some of these item it may not be immediately obvious what the impact is likely to be and investigation will be required.

We estimate one day to do an initial assessment and point out where further research might be required.

Unfortunately, this request has hit us at a very busy time. We are not sure when we will be able to schedule time to give you an initial response. How soon do you need feedback?
As discussed with Danny - to be pushed to next month due to work load.

Hi Danny - as discussed yesterday we are now keen to get this back on track. This is especially as the mismatch in apache configs was a contributing factor to the issues that we experienced on the Festival launch.

We are looking to do this sometime late next week if we can get the appropriate resource together from BT to do this.

Kirsty from BT (cc on this) may contact you to arrange some time for a BT Apache expert to contact you.

Hope that will be OK with you guys.

Russ

Hi Indy,

Thanks for this,

I think Danny was going to try and catch up with you or Uzma today re. the form (he's at Churchill Place)

A few questions / points to clarify while I think of them :

2) In terms of the Event Zones, I assume this (Part A Q1) is a drop down, but it's not clear form the attached which field goes in the drop downs?

Are the field under the "Correct zone name" header the 5 values we should use for this drop down?
What are the values in the 'Event Zone' column used for?

3) Dates / Times

I think we probably need to discuss this further, our original understanding was this was to be nothing more than a 'free text' box.
We then had some discussion on Friday with Uzama and ION re. this being a little more constrained, although nothign was agreed.
It now seems to be suggested (not unreasonably) that the dates on this part of the form is in turn constrained by the "Event Zone" selected.

While each of these incremental addition are obviously nice and given time/budget achievable, they almost certainly will have a significant impact on the work and costs involved in constructing the form [if the form is to be both dynamic and usable without Javascript for accessibility reasons it gets even more complex) and the complexity of data model needed to store the data, at both out and and ION's end.

If it is decided we need to go down the more complex route, in terms of preselecting the dates for the user are you expecting that for a given date range the user will be presented with a list of date next to which they have to add both a start and end time? 

ie. for example for the 'Royal Artillery Barracks zone" where the dates run from the 27 July - 6 August and the 29 August - 5 Sept for Olympics and Paralympics respectively, would 

27th July : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
28th July : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
29th July : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
... etc.
5th August : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
6th August : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
29th August : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
30th August : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]
... etc.
5th September : [user enters start time] : [user enters end time]

In effect allowing up to 20x date fields each with their own start and end times?

3) When Uzma initially discussed this work and we costed it, it was based on the assumption you would look at the data collected in our backend / export it in CSV to view in Excel etc.

We now understand that you need to export the date to the database/system ION is building (we discussed this on Friday on a conference call with Uzma and ION)

Hopefully this won't present too many issues, but two things to be aware of:

 a) We were not expecting the CSV export to be used as a feed to drive another system. While we are happy to try and confirm to / use the same fields as ION is using (if ION get us the fields they are using internally in the few days then we can use those values as a basis when creating out our internal data model / form fields), we are not expecting (at least within the given costs) to build a feed exactly to ION's requirements (for example we will be exporting dates in YYYYMMDD format and will expect the ION system to import the date fields in the format, rather than us exporting dates in a custom format).

 b) We will simply be providing a 'export CSV' option in the backend CMS, you can manually export this file and email or FTP this file to ION as often as your like, but each export will contain all previous values, this should be an issue as ION can simply ignore any records they already have entered in tier system.

We can look at constructing a more tightly coupled integration with ION, but obviously there are additional costs here.

4) Location / City / Town / Place of Birth / Organisation Status

We are assuming these are free text fields? 

5) Getting a copy of the final fields that ION will be using.

In fact given that these fields will eventually need to be imported by ION it probably makes sense for them to provide us with the database fields and allowed values they are using themselves. 

Although do be aware that:

 a) we will need these values to commence work 
 b) any changes to these fields could have significant costs, on top of any CR cost from ION, we will also need to change the form, the data model, the CSV export and (depending on how far along we are) then retest everything.

7) C.2.i "Please provide the following details of your licence: " 
Does this need to be checkboxes or can it just be a drop down (ie. can a user have more than one checked?

8) C.2.ii and B.5.i "Issuing body (local authority or The Royal Parks):
I assume the values here are taken form the C column of your spreadsheet? ie. "Local Authority" ?

* please be aware that in terms of "or other please specify....................." the other field will be a separate field in our data model and therefore our CSV export ie. we will have a field called "issuing_body" and a field named "issuing_body_other" which may not entirely match with ION's data model. Although on import it should be fairly simply form them to merge these fields if that is what they required.

9) That "PART D - DECLARATION" is not require on the electronic versions, other than a checkbox next to a block of T&C text that is editable by yourselves.

Happy to have a chat though any of this...

I think the most important things in terms of getting the ball rolling are:

i) agreeing on date/time and how that works.
ii) getting the field values that ION are expecting to use (*)

(*) as I have said above we can't guarantee (within the given budget) that our CSV export will 100% match ION's data model or ideal CSV format, but we will (if we receive them this week) use them as a basis for constructing our data model meaning that only the smallest manipulation will need to be done by IOn when importing our CSV export. 

thanks

Jamie

subject: Dropdowns on homepage
description:
From: Andy Watkins As part of the homepage redesign we’ve added sports dropdown selectors, intended primarily to improve our search rankings. However, our SEO consultant has pointed out that these may not achieve this because they don’t have actual html links as the value parameters. Could I ask you to take a look at updating this - it doesn’t look too complex to me - but then what do I know?!**** ** ** I should point out that you guys haven’t built this wrong. I did specifically ask him if there were any instructions I ought to pass on, and he advised that if humans could follow the links, so would Google. **** ** ** I’ve pasted the content of his email below for info.**** ** ** Cheers,**** Andy **** ** ** Looking at the way this has been implemented I'm not sure it meets our objective of getting a direct link from your homepage to each of the sport landing pages. I'm not sure how google will interpret how this has been implemented. If you are using a drop down to create these links ideally each option in the drop down would provide a direct link. For an example of this please take a look at the CNN homepage where they have a similar drop down for their programs. **** ** ** **** ****
****
**** ****
****

**** **** ** **

subject: Ability to set DFP tags on a per page basis in the CMS
description:
At some point in the future it may be useful to give Erin the ability to set DFP tags on a per page basis using a meta data field in the CMS.

This will save the need for us to hard code exceptions in the back end tag generation code (a current example the the BP arts page).

There is no immediate need for this, but we should probably revisit what would be required and schedule a time to do it once the current tranche of work is out of the way, so it's there when it;s needed in future.

subject: A mechanism for removing webcams
description: Is there a way to temporarily remove webcams from the site?

comments.value: Is there a way to temporarily remove webcams from the site?

Ticket #5094 "Hiding webcams" was closed and merged into this ticket.

Last comment in ticket #5094: Hi Tom,

No it's not as simple as it sounds, we actually have a ticket open which I have been working on a response to.

Part of the problem is we can't easily dependency track all the pages that use that thumbnail (homepage, venue pages, hub pages etc.) and hence which pages need to be automatically republished. We also have the problem that the image isn't currently replaced / suppressed, only the main page that shows the image and possible links to that page.

The ideal solution would probably be a mix of suppression (when a checkbox is checked, we won't return this webcam to hub pages and/or components) but also to replace the image itself (and all the various repurposing / thumbnails of the image) with a holding image, the tricky thing is here is to stop the feed overwriting the 'holding image' when it next runs.

In short, the above is not something we can get in place this afternoon although we can try and push forward the priority on this work.

You should however be able suppress the webcam (via the checkbox on the page) and then republish the page, the homepage and hub pages, I think if you do that the webcam will be removed from the hub and homepage.

Jamie

Hi Uzma,

It looks like the the space/comma between Manufacture and Supply being lost on save we're just looking at why this is.
Uzma, just requested an update.
Uzma, Tensar is now sitting under Manufacture, supply and install. We are still looking at why you were having trouble changing the sector.

Problem is with data editor which - for multi-fields - presumes that you're entering content comma-separated.
Fix is probably to amend
   js/editor.js
to use String.splitCSV  (http://www.greywyvern.com/?post=258)
rather than String.split().
Also need to make muli-valued fields that have commas in them be OUTPUT with quotes.
I expect it's in data-form.xsl.
Not all that simple to fix, estimate: at least 1/2 day (+ deployment)

PROTECT 

 

Thanks you guys, I really appreciate you looking at this.

subject: Re: Issues with the Festival.London2012.com
description:
Hi,
It appears that the design collateral we received for this was missing a few
images.
  /images/presentation/dotted-border-grey.gif
  /images/interface/footer-bg.png
   -> ./images/presentation/footer-bg.png
  /images/presentation/blue-header-submit.png
It also appears that there's a missing error doc, at /error-404.php.
However, this doesn't explain why you only started seeing this behaviour
this morning. The site is a static one and hasn't changed in the last 60
days.
It might take us some time to hunt down the missing images (we might even
have to go back to the designers). Or, alternatively, we could just remove
them from the css files. It appears that no-one has noticed their absence in
60 days so they might not be that important. However ... this isn't a call
that I can make.
Can you give me an indication of what you would like us to do please?
 1. Try to contact the design agency to track down the missing images.
 2. Amend the css files to remove all reference to the above images (as it
would appear their absence is not causing a problem).
In the meantime, I will fix the missing error-404.php.
Thanks in advance,
Kieran

Sorry, Kieran – which report shows this info?

Hi Morag,
Here is last week's report. You are on the list of recipients of the weekly
email. Are they getting through to you?
Kieran



---------- Forwarded message ----------
From: <kieran@kitsite.com>
Date: Mon, Aug 1, 2011 at 11:00 AM
Subject: Festival sigups | Automated report
To: kieran@kitsite.com, morag.reavley@london2012.com, danny@kitsite.com,
chris.adams@london2012.com, wahome@gmail.com



Please see attachment.

The "Signup source" indicates where the user originally registered.
"festival.london2012.com" indicates that the user is NEW user, who
registered on the festival site.
"www.london2012.com" indicates that the user is an EXISTING user, who came
to the festival site and registered their festival preferences.

The first row might be considered the "headline figure". It shows the total
number of people who have registered one or more festival preferences -
regardless of whether they're a new or existing user.

The is an automated email, but feel free to contact kieran@kitsite.com if
you have any questions.

Thank you – I do get this report (in fact I just got it now) but had deleted the last one.

Much appreciated.

Hi Morag,

Just been looking over this, do you have an idea of [essential] scope / budget?

The reason I ask is on one hand we could slightly shoehorn it to be a basic form, with 2 or 3 extra questions dependent on the role (or url) and a basic CSV export, with all filtering done offline in Excel.

At the other end we could look at building something much nicer and tab based with multiple pages and some backend tools to handle the filtering.

It we we're fulfil all the business requirements to the line, it would probably be more the latter, but obviously with that come increased costs.

- What questions vary on role is it just Q1 and Q2 or could these also vary in number? also will the type always be a free text box?
- Other than the role specific question above, I can't see any fields that depend on the answers to previous fields, but can I just check this is correct?
- Can we assume that the fields will be fixed / agreed and will not change post us starting work? or that if they are you are prepared for possibly significant additional costs / delays. If we are aware before speccing the work that text may change then we can look making this process more manageable, but obviously it will cost more to build that flexibility into the system.

In terms of backend screens / reporting it may be easier to talk though this on the phone.

I'm around all day so when ever is good for you, feel free to call.

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie!

I am asking my colleague Jessica to provide answers to the questions below as I am on leave this week.

Jess, please can you review the below and send Jamie your thoughts, including budget?

Thank you!

Morag

Hello there

Can we catch up on this? My colleague Jess sent through some responses to this while I was away so it would be good to get a sense from you of cost / time requirements.

Many thanks!

Morag

Lets catch up tomorrow, around all day so when ever is good for you.

* when you say "sent through some responses" I assume you mean to you, I not sure we received anything, if we did my apologies as it wasn't forwarded onto me.

Hello

This is what Jess sent on 28 June – sorry it didn’t get to you!

Am in training most of today but will try to give you a call around lunchtime or post 5!

Many thanks

Morag

Hi there

Morag has asked me to respond in her absence and as the original request came from me, it would seem to make sense ;)

I have looked down the email trail below and hope I have pulled out the questions for which you require answers.

- What questions vary on role is it just Q1 and Q2 or could these also vary in number? No always just one and two, maybe just one sometime if the sport doesn’t want to add another question. also will the type always be a free text box? Yes
- Other than the role specific question above, I can't see any fields that depend on the answers to previous fields, but can I just check this is correct? Yes – depending on role you select this determines which questions you get for 1 and/or two but this is the only dependent field.
- Can we assume that the fields will be fixed / agreed and will not change post us starting work? or that if they are you are prepared for possibly significant additional costs / delays. If we are aware before speccing the work that text may change then we can look making this process more manageable, but obviously it will cost more to build that flexibility into the system. – no once we are live they will be fixed

Regarding the backend, obviously the easier it is to use the better. My main requirement will be to be able to print off the applications to take to interview (so all the information is easy to read in the interview) and to do analysis to make sure an organisation hasn’t applied more than once for the same role, report on the number of roles they have applied for, look at the number of applications per role. Other solutions we are evaluating are cheap but have quite basic backend functionality e.g. using adobe forms. It would be great if you could cost with a csv backend but also something a bit more sophisticated with tabs.
Do you know how long it will take you to get a view on costs, I am really keen to make a decision by the end of the week as I know we are running short of time.

If it is easier to chat about any of these requirements please do not hesitate to call me on 02032012656.

Thanks
Jess

Speak to you post 5

Enjoy the training :)

Jamie

Hi Morag,

Just wanted to pick this back up, I know we had 90% of a conversation on it but kind of forgot if I was waiting on any info back from yourself or Jess or if you we're waiting on me.

Should I go ahead and create a proposal based on your requirements and our understanding of how we would implement them, with that level of time/budget? We estimated 8-10 days, when we did a rough breakdown of the work internally.

thanks

Jamie

Many thanks!

Morag

Hi Morag,

Attached are costs / a quote for this work, 

I've had a second look at the requirements and it is a significantly more complex form that I first realised. Given that in the past forms of this complexity have required a fair amount of to-ing and fro-ing and testing. I have explicitly added on 2 days for project management. 

I do realise this quote is higher than the ball park I estimated last week and that the allocated budget for this piece of work is not significant. 

Do let Danny or I know if you think our costs fall way outside budget and we could possibly look at ways to de-scope the work; although I have to be honest it's not immediately obvious what we could cut out to significantly reduce costs.

Jamie
Thanks, Jamie. I think these costs look fine. Showing client now – will let you know asap but I’m sure we’ll need you to go ahead...
Morag, do we have deadline for this one?

Update on this: the client has come back with a query as to the feasibilty of extending the original form somewhat. The suggested revised structure is attached. The basic change is inclusion of a range of personal identification information within each of the two Team Leader sections (involving document ID, addresses, D&I data, emergency contact details). This makes each of those two sections substantially longer. 

Please don't spend too long looking at this but can you advise:
1. Is the additional scope feasible within the timeframe of mid September
2. Cost impact (roughly)

My feeling is that we say no to this request and say we need to stick to the original scope, but I did say I would discuss it with you.

I also have some questions around the layout of this form - are you envisaging it as one form or four pages? Do we need css creating for this? 

Please can we have a quick catch up on this today? I am also planning to hand this over to Kavita to lead on from our end, so would like to get her up to speed on it.

Thanks!

Hi Morag,

That looks like a substantially larger / more complex form than before, more than just extra fields there is also the added project management workload of making sure we have all the relevant values for each drop down and/or reg-ex's for checking the format of certain fields and slightly more extensive testing.

It's probably another 2/3 days development and an extra day of project management (but I haven't looked *that* closely)

As you mention, we were expecting this to live on one page but this size of the (new) form would be more suited to a 4 page, 4 step form with the ability to save at any stage (funnily enough I am having deja-vu re. Ceremonies; in that if from the outset we had knew the form was going to get more complex, much like Ceremonies, we may have suggested a different route / approach; indeed as we have only just started on this piece of work that is still an option; I will discuss internally). 

Much as I don't like to turn work down. I do wonder if (we can't go down the Rails route) it is better to just say no now in order to stem any further feature creep on a piece of work that is already fairly tight on timescale and already a large single page form. The biggest danger / risk / problem with all these data capture projects is flux or creep around the fields that need to be captured (inevitable to some extent, as more people are aware of the project and want the form to capture data pertinent to them, but equally a risk in terms of regression and errors creeping in / deadlines being missed).

That said we haven't gone so far that it would be a massive disruption to add the extra fields at this stage, although I would question whether you can have a form this long on one page without a 'save' option and therefore it may be worth quickly deciding if we would be better off re-scoping the project as a Rails app with a 4 stage / page form, that can be saved at any stage (although lack of lead time - to allow BTS to agree to us using a hosted Rails server - rather than development time is probably the biggest hurdle in a late change in architecture/approach; )

Can I also check the client is OK with this just living on a standard Games maker template, we haven't costed for any kind of complex design work above the standard form layout and page look and feel. We were thinking along the lines of the accessible volunteer form.

Jamie

Thanks, Jamie.

My feeling is that we say ‘no’ to any form amplification, for the reasons of a) time b) added complexity to the form c) the requirement to have to save the form (which I think would be key, given there are two people involved here).

Page design – I think the basic GM form is fine. If we did something more designed we would use a separate budget and could use a separate designer for page layout, but I think the issue is time. I’m assuming there isn’t time to get a third party to do any html production (when would you need it for)?

Morag

Hi Kavita, 

I'm not sure whether you recall, but there was a pivotal issue raised about the apostrophes appearing in every field.
The reason the apostrophe was put in there was to address this precise issue (telephone numbers being treated as integers when - in fact - they should be strings). However, the "apostrophe fix" appears (given the issue you raised) not to work in "SharePoint".

I'm afraid I don't have any experience of SharePoint, but I would suggest that it might be an idea to do something approximating:

 1. Select the entire column containing the telephone numbers.
 2. Find the menu item, or control button that that allows you to specify the "display format" (possibly known as "field format").
 3. Select a display format of "text", or "unformatted", or "raw text" / other. Basically you're looking for a format that ISN'T a number type.

The problem incidentally is that spreadsheet software treats fields as numbers by default. This means that the following issues arise when displaying fields containing telephone numbers:
 1. Leading "0"s are omitted (as they're redundant when displaying numbers).
 2. When the field reaches a certain length (i.e. over about 10 digits) numbers get displayed in scientific notation (e.g. 2.5234+E11).
You don't want either of these behaviours for telephone numbers, so you need to tell SharePojnt that these fields are NOT numbers.

If you have any questions, please ask, but bear in mind that I don't have a copy of SharePoint so I can't answer SharePoint-related questions with any authority!

I hope this helps,

Kind regards,

Kieran
